segment.name: Beginning of message
segment.documentation: BGM, A segment for unique identification of the message and specification of its function.

segment.name: Date/time/period
segment.documentation: DTM, A segment identifying the date and/or time of message generation and/or other dates and/or times concerning the whole message.

segment.name: Free text
segment.documentation: FTX, A segment giving free text information, in coded or clear form, for specifying information concerning the whole message.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 1: A group of segments giving information about involved healthcare parties like the service requester, the service provider, parties to get copies of the request and/or the results, related service providers, origin of clinical information, supervising healthcare party, healthcare administrative information, sample collector, sample collector location and/or other parties related to the message.

segment.name: Party identification
segment.documentation: PNA, A segment for specifying the identification, name and address of involved healthcare organisations or professionals.

segment.name: Address
segment.documentation: ADR, A segment for specifying the address of the actual healthcare party.

segment.name: Communication contact
segment.documentation: COM, A segment giving communication numbers for the actual healthcare party.

segment.name: Free text
segment.documentation: FTX, A segment with free text information, in coded or clear form, for specifying unstructured telecommunication numbers of the actual healthcare party including electronic mail address.

segment.name: Reference
segment.documentation:
RFF, A segment for specifying alternative identification numbers of the actual healthcare party assigned by the involved healthcare parties.
This segment also keeps a reference to another party if the current party is related to another party such as department in a hospital, a physician in a department, etc.

segment.name: Sequence details
segment.documentation: SEQ, A segment for allocating a sequence number to the individual healthcare party allowing each healthcare party to be referenced from within the message.

segment.name: Language
segment.documentation: LAN, A segment for specifying the language used by the actual healthcare party.

segment.name: Organisation classification details
segment.documentation: SPR, A segment for specifying the type and medical speciality of a healthcare organisation.

segment.name: Qualification
segment.documentation: QUA, A segment for specifying the professional medical qualifications of a person.

segment.name: Employment details
segment.documentation: EMP, A segment for specifying the type, medical speciality and the position or military rank of a healthcare professional.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 2: HAN-SG3-SG4-SG5 A group of segments for specifying a service order.

segment.name: Financial charges allocation
segment.documentation: FCA, A segment giving information concerning payment category for this order.

segment.name: Processing information
segment.documentation: GEI, A segment to provide the service type of the service order, i.e. new order, order modification etc.

segment.name: Reference
segment.documentation:
RFF, A segment for specifying the identification number of the order allocated by various healthcare parties, such as service requester, etc.
The segment is also used for referencing a related healthcare party specified in segment group 1.

segment.name: Date/time/period
segment.documentation: DTM, A segment for specifying the date and/or time concerning the order such as issue date of order, due date of report, etc.

segment.name: Priority
segment.documentation: PTY, A segment for specifying the requested reporting priority for the whole order.

segment.name: Clinical information
segment.documentation: CIN, A segment for specifying the reason for request as well as comments from the requester as a diagnosis concerning this order.

segment.name: Free text
segment.documentation: FTX, A segment with free text information, in coded or clear form, for specifying the reason for request as well as comments from the requester concerning this order.

segment.name: Language
segment.documentation: LAN, A segment for specifying the language of the service order and the requested reporting language.

segment.name: Package
segment.documentation: PAC, A segment for specifying the number of sample containers accompanying a service order.

segment.name: Information required
segment.documentation: IRQ, A segment for specifying the requirements concerning acknowledgment of the service order.

segment.name: Test method
segment.documentation: TEM, A segment for specifying the reason for the request.

segment.name: Handling instructions
segment.documentation: HAN, A segment for specifying the requested commenting level of detail of the service report.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 3: A group of segments for specifying a standing service order.

segment.name: Scheduling conditions
segment.documentation: SCC, A segment for specifying the delivery plan.

segment.name: Quantity
segment.documentation: QTY, A segment for specifying the number of times per time interval a standing order should be performed.

segment.name: Date/time/period
segment.documentation: DTM, A segment for specifying the start and end date and time for set of ordered investigations and the time interval between each repetition.

segment.name: Free text
segment.documentation: FTX, A segment with free text information, in coded or clear form, for specifying the end condition and additional execution instruction of a standing service order.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 4: A group of segments for specifying a reference to another service order.

segment.name: Document/message details
segment.documentation: DOC, A segment for specifying the document name.

segment.name: Reference
segment.documentation: RFF, A segment for specifying the identification number of the referenced order.

segment.name: Date/time/period
segment.documentation: DTM, A segment for specifying the issue date and/or time of the referenced order.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 5: PDI-NAT-LAN-CCI-SG6-SG7-SG13-SG15 A group of segments specifying the subject of investigation.

segment.name: Attribute
segment.documentation: ATT, A segment for specifying the type of the subject of investigation.

segment.name: Reference
segment.documentation:
RFF, A segment for specifying the identification numbers of the actual subject of investigation.
This segment is also used for a reference to a healthcare party in segment group 1 specifying a supervising healthcare party.

segment.name: Address
segment.documentation: ADR, A segment for specifying the address details of the subject of investigation.

segment.name: Communication contact
segment.documentation: COM, A segment providing a telecommunication number for the subject of investigation.

segment.name: Handling instructions
segment.documentation: HAN, A segment for specifying a collection warning concerning the subject of investigation.

segment.name: Relationship
segment.documentation: REL, A segment for specifying the association between subjects of investigation such as donor, foetus, etc. as well as the relationship of a related person to the patient.

segment.name: Item description
segment.documentation: IMD, A segment for specifying the description of the material being investigated if the subject of investigation is a material.

segment.name: Free text
segment.documentation: FTX, A segment with free text information, in coded or clear form, for specifying additional information about the material as well as an unstructured telecommunication number of the subject of investigation.

segment.name: Party identification
segment.documentation: PNA, A segment for identifying the patient and related person or name by specifying various patient name details and official patient ID.

segment.name: Date/time/period
segment.documentation: DTM, A segment for specifying relevant dates and/or times for the patient such as date of birth, date of death, etc.

segment.name: Person demographic information
segment.documentation: PDI, A segment for specifying demographic information such as sex, marital status and religion.

segment.name: Nationality
segment.documentation: NAT, A segment for specifying the nationality of a person.

segment.name: Language
segment.documentation: LAN, A segment for specifying the language used by the person.

segment.name: Characteristic/class id
segment.documentation: CCI, A segment for specifying the species or breed of an animal.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 6: A group of segments for specifying healthcare administrative information concerning the actual subject of investigation.

segment.name: Attendance
segment.documentation: PAS, A segment for specifying patient administrative information such as administrative status concerning actual hospital stay or out-patient visit or ward stay related to the subject of investigation.

segment.name: Place/location identification
segment.documentation: LOC, A segment for specifying the physical patient care location in terms of ward, room, bed, etc.

segment.name: Date/time/period
segment.documentation: DTM, A segment for specifying admission and/or discharge date and time or start and/or end date and time of a ward stay.

segment.name: Reference
segment.documentation: RFF, This segment keeps a reference to a healthcare party for specifying healthcare administrative information such as hospital, department, etc. where patient is admitted, located, etc.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 7: A group of segments giving information about a clinical observation including the origin of the clinical information. The clinical information may be a symptom, physical sign, anamnesis (medical history), clinical observation, diagnosis, etc.

segment.name: Characteristic value
segment.documentation: CAV, A segment for specifying the type of clinical information.

segment.name: Clinical information
segment.documentation: CIN, A segment for specifying the type of clinical observation, description of the clinical observation itself as well as the degree of certainty concerning the clinical observation.

segment.name: Language
segment.documentation: LAN, A segment for specifying the language related to the clinical observation.

segment.name: Date/time/period
segment.documentation: DTM, A segment for specifying date and times related to the clinical information, the clinical observation itself and the origin of clinical information.

segment.name: Free text
segment.documentation: FTX, A segment with free text information, in coded or clear form, for description of the clinical information.

segment.name: Reference
segment.documentation: RFF, This segment keeps a reference to a healthcare party for specifying origin of clinical information.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 8: SG9-SG10 A group of segments for specifying a clinical investigation result item and the clinical investigation itself.

segment.name: Status
segment.documentation: STS, A segment for specifying the status of the clinical investigation, e.g. preliminary results, final results, etc.

segment.name: Sequence details
segment.documentation: SEQ, A segment for allocating a sequence number to a clinical investigation result item to allow referencing from within this message to a specific clinical investigation result item.

segment.name: Processing information
segment.documentation: GEI, A segment for specifying the service type of the clinical investigation result item, e.g. new result item.

segment.name: Result
segment.documentation: RSL, A segment for specifying the numerical value or a coded text value of a clinical investigation result item including unit of measurement, arithmetic comparator and the deviating result indicator.

segment.name: Characteristic/class id
segment.documentation: CCI, A segment for identifying the clinical investigation and to describe specifications to the clinical investigation.

segment.name: Clinical information
segment.documentation: CIN, A segment giving a text value of a clinical investigation result item as well as a comment to the clinical investigation result item as a diagnosis.

segment.name: Date/time/period
segment.documentation: DTM, A segment for specifying relevant date and times concerning the investigation such as date and time for investigation performed, last status change and a date value of a clinical observation.

segment.name: Free text
segment.documentation: FTX, A segment with free text information, in coded or clear form, for specifying the text value of a clinical investigation as well as comments to the clinical investigation and the investigation result item.

segment.name: Reference
segment.documentation: RFF, This segment keeps a reference to the 'parent' clinical investigation result item if needed.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 9: A group of segments giving the reference limits of a clinical investigation result item.

segment.name: Result
segment.documentation: RSL, A segment for specifying the numerical reference interval of an investigation result item and the type of reference interval.

segment.name: Free text
segment.documentation: FTX, A segment with free text information, in coded or clear form, for specifying the textual reference limits of an investigation result item.

segment.name: Characteristic/class id
segment.documentation: CCI, A segment for specifying a reference population, e.g. age, sex, smokers, etc.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 10: A group of segments for identifying the persons and/or organisations involved in producing an investigation result item.

segment.name: Relationship
segment.documentation: REL, A segment for specifying the type of relationship of a related healthcare service provider to the clinical investigation result item.

segment.name: Reference
segment.documentation: RFF, A segment for specifying a reference to healthcare parties in segment group 1 where the related healthcare professional or organisation is identified.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 11: A group of segments for specifying a clinical intervention.

segment.name: Clinical intervention
segment.documentation: CLI, A segment for specifying the type of intervention and the intervention itself.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 12: A group of segments to describe interventions involving drugs.

segment.name: Item description
segment.documentation: IMD, A segment for identifying a drug.

segment.name: Dosage administration
segment.documentation: DSG, A segment for specifying the dosage and administration specifications of a drug.

segment.name: Free text
segment.documentation: FTX, A segment with free text information, in coded or clear form, for specifying dosage and administration specification of a drug.

segment.name: Parties and instruction
segment.documentation: INP, A segment for specifying the dosage regime.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 13: TDT-HAN-LOC-ADR-SG14 A group of segments containing information about the samples collected or to be collected concerning the requested investigation.

segment.name: Sequence details
segment.documentation: SEQ, A segment for allocating a sequence number to the sample to allow referencing from within this message to a specific sample.

segment.name: Item description
segment.documentation: IMD, A segment for specifying the characteristics of a sample like type of sample, anatomical origin and sample preservation material.

segment.name: Process identification
segment.documentation: PRC, A segment for specifying information about type of collection procedure and subsequent handling of the sample.

segment.name: Reference
segment.documentation:
RFF, A segment for specifying the identification numbers of the actual sample allocated by service requester.
This segment also keeps a reference to healthcare parties related to this actual sample such as the sample collector and sample collection location.
This segment in addition keeps a reference to the "parent" sample if this sample is part of or derived from another sample.

segment.name: Quantity
segment.documentation: QTY, A segment for specifying information about sample volume or weight.

segment.name: Date/time/period
segment.documentation: DTM, A segment for specifying relevant dates and times concerning the sample such as start and/or end date and time or period for sample collection, etc.

segment.name: Package
segment.documentation: PAC, A segment specifying the number of sample containers this sample consists of.

segment.name: Priority
segment.documentation: PTY, A segment for specifying the sampling priority.

segment.name: Free text
segment.documentation: FTX, A segment with free text information, in coded or clear form, expressing the comments of the sample collector, the comments of the requester to the sample, anatomical origin of sample, sample location description, etc.

segment.name: Transport information
segment.documentation: TDT, A segment for specifying the transport logistics of the collected sample.

segment.name: Handling instructions
segment.documentation: HAN, A segment for specifying sample handling warning.

segment.name: Place/location identification
segment.documentation: LOC, A segment for specifying the location for sample collection in terms of hospital ward, room and bed number.

segment.name: Address
segment.documentation: ADR, A segment for specifying the address for the sample collection.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 14: A group of segments for specifying the pre-treatment performed relating to a sample.

segment.name: Clinical intervention
segment.documentation: CLI, A segment for describing the pre-treatment administered.

segment.name: Item description
segment.documentation: IMD, A segment for specifying the substance administered for pre-treatment.

segment.name: Dosage administration
segment.documentation: DSG, A segment for specifying the route of administration of the pre-treatment.

segment.name: Date/time/period
segment.documentation: DTM, A segment for specifying relevant date and times for the pre-treatment like start, end or duration of administration.

segment.name: Free text
segment.documentation: FTX, A segment with free text information, in coded or clear form, for describing the pre-treatment.

segment.name: Quantity
segment.documentation: QTY, A segment for specifying amount of substance administered.

segment.name: Parties and instruction
segment.documentation: INP, A segment for specifying dosage regime.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 15: RFF-HAN-SG16 A group of segments for specifying a requested investigation.

segment.name: Processing information
segment.documentation: GEI, A segment for specifying the service type of the requested investigation, e.g. new investigation, changes to a previous requested investigation, etc.

segment.name: Characteristic/class id
segment.documentation: CCI, A segment for specifying the characteristics of the investigation. The characteristics may concern system, component or property examined, etc.

segment.name: Priority
segment.documentation: PTY, A segment for specifying the performing and reporting priority of the requested investigation.

segment.name: Quantity
segment.documentation: QTY, A segment for specifying the number of times to perform a requested investigation.

segment.name: Clinical information
segment.documentation: CIN, A segment for specifying the reason for request as a diagnosis.

segment.name: Date/time/period
segment.documentation: DTM, A segment for specifying date and times relevant for this requested investigation such as date and time of investigation request issued, investigation result due date and time, etc.

segment.name: Free text
segment.documentation: FTX, A segment with free text information, in coded or clear form, for specifying the reason for request, requester's comments as well as comments to the investigation itself.

segment.name: Test method
segment.documentation: TEM, A segment for specifying the reason for the requested investigation.

segment.name: Monetary amount
segment.documentation: MOA, A segment for specifying the type of cost, the amount of cost and possibly currency unit used concerning the investigation.

segment.name: Reference
segment.documentation: RFF, This segment keeps a reference to one or more samples related to this requested investigation such as the sample(s) involved in this investigation.

segment.name: Handling instructions
segment.documentation: HAN, A segment specifying the requested commenting level of detail concerning the requested investigation.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 16: A group of segments for specifying a standing requested investigation.

segment.name: Scheduling conditions
segment.documentation: SCC, A segment for specifying the delivery plan.

segment.name: Quantity
segment.documentation: QTY, A segment for specifying the number of times per time interval a requested investigation should be performed.

segment.name: Date/time/period
segment.documentation: DTM, A segment for specifying the start and end date and time for a requested investigation and the time interval between each repetition.

segment.name: Free text
segment.documentation: FTX, A segment with free text information, in coded or clear form, for specifying the end-condition and additional execution instructions of a standing requested investigation.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 17: A group of segments for specifying authentication details.

segment.name: Authentication result
segment.documentation: AUT, A segment for specifying results of an authentication procedure.

segment.name: Date/time/period
segment.documentation: DTM, A segment for specifying the date and time for the validity of the authentication.
